name: Companies in the target population and selected for the sample, by industry: 2019
description: Companies in the target population and selected for the sample, by industry: 2019

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_companies_selected_for_the_sample_all_companies
variableMeasured.description: Companies Selected For The Sample All Companies

variableMeasured.name: field_companies_selected_for_the_sample_noncertainties
variableMeasured.description: Companies Selected For The Sample Noncertainties

variableMeasured.name: field_companies_selected_for_the_sample_certainties
variableMeasured.description: Companies Selected For The Sample Certainties

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Certainties were companies with a probability of selection of 1 because they had $1 million or more in R&D costs in the 2016 Business R&D and Innovation Survey—Microbusiness, they had 500 or more employees, or they had high payroll or receipts defined by stratum specific cutoffs. Noncertainties are companies with a probability of selection of less than 1.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics and Census Bureau, 2020 Annual Business Survey, Data Year 2019.
